comments: For n>0, a(n)= number of endofunctions of [n] mapping some x<>1 to 1. - _Len Smiley_, Nov 15 2001 (Endofunction interpretation from a(n)=n*[n^(n-1)-(n-1)^(n-1)].)
references: Problem 10781, Amer. Math. Monthly, 107, Feb. 2000, p. 176
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=0,...,100
D. Callan, A Bijection between Marked Trees
formula: a(n) = n*A055869(n-1). As n increases, a(n)/a(n-1)-a(n-1)/a(n-2) tends towards e.E.g.f.: (1-x)/(1-T), where T=T(x) is Euler's tree function (see A000169). The E.g.f. for n>0 terms only (applicable to endofunctions) is (T - x)/(1 - T). - _Len Smiley_, Dec 10 2001
maple: f := n->n*sum(binomial(n-1,j-1)*(n-1)^(n-j),j=2..n); g := n->n^n-n*(n-1)^(n-1); h := n->sum( binomial(n,j)*j^(j-1)*(n-j)^(n-j),j=2..n); k := n->sum(binomial(n,j-1)*(j-1)^(j-1)*(n-j)^(n-j),j=2..n); #then a(n)=f(n)=g(n)=k(n)
prog: (PARI) { for (n=0, 100, write("b060226.txt", n, " ", n^n - n*(n - 1)^(n - 1)); ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 03 2009](Haskell)a060226 0 = 1a060226 n = a000312 n - n * a000312 (n - 1)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 27 2012
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 12 2001
